intro: Nothoscordum vittatum, commonly known as the yellow rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves and produces a cluster of small, fragrant flowers at the top of a slender stem. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Nothoscordum vittatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
